intro: Acer duplicatoserratum var. chinense, commonly known as the Chinese twin-tooth maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its finely toothed, ovate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras for seed dispersal. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. This variety is valued for its ornamental foliage and adaptability to temperate climates.
